 We've already been over this, many times before. There's already a system of registration in place, it's background check Form 4473. It lists all the information on who bought the gun(s) and what was bought. The law specifically says that the seller has to maintain all of these forms for the duration of their business license, and once the business closes they have to forward all the paperwork to the ATF.
 
 And then there's the firearms trace data that's protected by the Tiahrt Amendment. All of these show who bought what, where they bought it, when they bought it, and where they live, and not a single person has to go down to the police station to do a thing to be in the system.
 
 And before anybody tries to argue that the NRA forced the ATF to destroy all records after so many days, don't try that argument; if it was truly done that way then there would be no trace data for the Tiahrt Amendment to cover.
 
 And then there's Form 3310.4, the form covering multiple handgun sales to an individual. Federal law specifies that this form has to be filled out anytime one person buys more than two handguns in a one week calender period. This form also has to be forwarded immediately to the ATF, who monitors that person's name to see how large their future purchases are. These people are watched as potential gun traffickers.
